judges: Before Jones, Eagen, O’Brien, Pomeroy and Barbieri, JJ.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
Decree affirmed. Appellant to pay costs.
Mr. Chief Justice Bell and Mr. Justice Roberts took no part in the consideration or decision of this case.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Morris H. Goldman, with him Samuel H. High, Jr., Morris Wolf, Wolf, Block, Schorr and Solis-Oohen, and High, Swartz, Roberts & Seidel, for appellant.
Richard P. Brown, Jr., with him W. Wesley Nagle, Samuel L. Sagendorph, Morgan, Lewis & Bockius, and Wright, Spencer, Manning & Sagendorph, for appellees.
casebody.head_matter:
Curtis Estate.
Argued October 1, 1971.
Before Jones, Eagen, O’Brien, Pomeroy and Barbieri, JJ.
Morris H. Goldman, with him Samuel H. High, Jr., Morris Wolf, Wolf, Block, Schorr and Solis-Oohen, and High, Swartz, Roberts & Seidel, for appellant.

December 20, 1971:
